headline: Boeing starts issuing layoff notices as planemaker trims 10% of workforce
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Boeing said on Wednesday it is issuing layoff notices starting this week to workers impacted by a broader plan by the heavily indebted planemaker to cut 17,000 jobs, or 10% of its global workforce.  U.S. staff receiving the notices this week will stay on Boeing's payroll until January to comply with federal requirements that give workers 60 days' notice prior to ending their employment.  News that Boeing would send out the Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification (WARN) in mid-November was widely expected.

headline: Aviation giants bail out major Northern Ireland employer in $450m rescue
summary: Boeing and Airbus will provide $450m (£353m) in emergency funding to troubled supplier Spirit AeroSystems, which employs 3,600 people in Belfast.

headline: Vietnam Airlines to request bids for 50 narrowbody jets next year
summary: BANDAR SERI BEGAWAN (Reuters) -Vietnam Airlines will issue requests for proposals to aircraft manufacturers next year to purchase 50 narrowbody jets, its CEO said on Wednesday.  The carrier last year signed a provisional deal with Boeing for 50 737 MAX planes that has yet to be finalised.  "In Vietnam we have to go through the bidding process, we have to open to others... The door is still open for everyone," Vietnam Airlines CEO Le Hong Ha told Reuters on the sidelines of an Association of Asia-Pacific Airlines event in Brunei.
